lines.content: 1. Ensure you have Java `17` installed on your Computer.
3. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the *home folder* for the program.
4. Open a command terminal, `cd` into the folder you put the jar file in,
and use the `java -jar Ryan.jar` command to run the application.
5. Type the command in the terminal window and press Enter to execute it.
6. Refer to [Features](#Features) below for details of each command.
> Words in UPPER_CASE are parameters supplied by the user.
> - e.g. in `todo DESCRIPTION`, `DESCRIPTION` is a parameter which can be used as `todo Assignment`
> Words in lower_case are to be typed exactly
> - e.g. in `deadline DESCRIPTION /by BY` should be typed as `deadline Quiz /by 2024-10-15`,
> where `deadline` and `/by` should be typed exactly
> Extraneous parameters for commands that do not take in parameters (such as list, bye) will be ignored.
> - e.g. if the command is `list everything`, it will be interpreted as `list`

Marks a specified task as done.
- Marks the task specified by `INDEX` as done
- `INDEX` has to be within the valid range of the task list
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
### Marking a task as not done: `unmark`
Marks a specified task as not done.
- Marks the task specified by `INDEX` as not done
- `INDEX` has to be within the valid range of the task list
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Removes a specified task from the task list.
- `INDEX` has to be within the valid range of the task list
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Filters tasks in which contain the given keywords.
- If multiple keywords are used, only results with all keywords will be shown

Data is saved automatically when the program is terminated, and loaded when the program starts.
If there is no existing data file, the program will create a new data file.
Ryan saves past data locally in `./data/ryan.txt` in the same directory as `Ryan.jar`.
Users can also manually update data by editing this file.
* Abstract class representing a command in the task management system.
* @param tasks The task list to operate on.
* @param ui The user interface for displaying messages.
* @throws RyanException If an error occurs during execution.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) throws RyanException;
* Returns whether this command should exit the application.
* @return false by default, can be overridden by specific commands.
* Command to add a Deadline task.
* Constructs a DeadlineCommand with the user input command string.
* @param command The user input specifying the deadline task.
* Executes the deadline creation command, adding a new Deadline task.
* @param tasks The task list to add the deadline task to.
* @param ui The user interface for displaying the result.
* @throws RyanException If the command format is incorrect.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) throws RyanException {
throw new RyanException("Deadline tasks should be in the format 'description /by deadline'.");
* Command to delete a task from the task list.
* Constructs a DeleteCommand with the index of the task to be deleted.
* @param index The 1-based index of the task to delete.
* @param tasks The task list to delete the task from.
* @param ui The user interface for displaying the result.
* @throws RyanException If the task index is invalid.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) throws RyanException {
* Checks if the given index is valid.
* @param size The size of the task list.
* @return true if the index is valid, false otherwise.
private boolean isValidIndex(int index, int size) {
* Command to add an Event task.
* Constructs an EventCommand with the user input command string.
* @param command The user input specifying the event task.
* Executes the event creation command, adding a new Event task.
* @param tasks The task list to add the event task to.
* @param ui The user interface for displaying the result.
* @throws RyanException If the command format is incorrect.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) throws RyanException {
throw new RyanException("Event tasks should be in the format 'description /from start-time /to end-time'.");
throw new RyanException("Event tasks should include both start-time and end-time.");

* Command to find tasks based on a description.
* Constructs a FindCommand with the search description.
* @param description The search term to find matching tasks.
* Executes the find command to search for tasks containing the description.
* @param taskList The task list to search through.
* @param ui The user interface to display the found tasks.
* @throws RyanException If the description is empty.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui) throws RyanException {
throw new RyanException("Find description cannot be empty.");
ui.showError("No tasks found with the given description.");

public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui) {

private boolean isValidIndex(int index, int size) {

* Constructs a TodoCommand with the specified task description.
* @param description The description of the Todo task.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui) throws RyanException {
throw new RyanException("Todo task description cannot be empty.");
* Command to unmark a task as completed.

* Checks if the given index is valid.

* Custom exception class for handling exceptions specific to the Ryan application.
* Constructs a new RyanException with the specified error message.
* @param message The detail message explaining the cause of the exception.
* Represents a task with a deadline.
* Constructs a Deadline task with a description and a deadline.
* @param by The deadline for the task.
* Returns the task type, which is "D" for deadline tasks.
* @return A string representing the task type.
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task in a file-friendly format.
* @return A string formatted for file storage.
return String.format("%s | %d | %s | %s", getTaskType(), isMarked() ? MARKED_VALUE : UNMARKED_VALUE, getDescription(), by);
* Returns a string representation of the deadline task for display.
* @return A formatted string representing the deadline task.
* Represents an event task with a start time and an end time.
* Constructs an Event task with a description, start time, and end time.
* @param from The start time of the event.
* @param to The end time of the event.
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns the task type, which is "E" for event tasks.
* @return A string representing the task type.
* Returns a string representation of the event task in a file-friendly format.
* @return A string formatted for file storage.
return String.format("%s | %d | %s | %s | %s", getTaskType(), isMarked() ? MARKED_VALUE : UNMARKED_VALUE, getDescription(), from, to);
* Returns a string representation of the event task for display.
* @return A formatted string representing the event task.
return EVENT_TASK_ICON + super.toString() + " (from: " + from + " to: " + to + ")";
* Represents a task with a description and a marked/unmarked status.
* Constructs a Task with the given description.
* Returns whether the task is marked as completed.
* @return true if the task is marked, false otherwise.
* Returns the description of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the task in a file-friendly format.
* @return A string formatted for file storage.
return String.format("%s | %d | %s", getTaskType(), isMarked() ? MARKED_VALUE : UNMARKED_VALUE, getDescription());
* Returns the type of the task. Default is "T" for Todo tasks.
* @return A string representing the task type.
* Returns a string representation of the task for display.
* @return A formatted string representing the task.
* Represents a simple task without a specific time.
* Constructs a Todo task with the given description.
* Returns the task type, which is "T" for todo tasks.
* @return A string representing the task type.
* Returns a string representation of the todo task for display.
* @return A formatted string representing the todo task.

* Represents a list of tasks and provides methods to manipulate it.

System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Prints the goodbye message when the program exits.
* @param message The error message to display.
* Shows a message when a task is added.
* @param task The task that was added.
* @param totalTasks The total number of tasks in the list.
public static void showTaskAdded(Task task, int totalTasks) {
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + totalTasks + " tasks in the list.");
* Shows a message when a task is deleted.
* @param task The task that was deleted.
* @param totalTasks The total number of tasks in the list.
public static void showTaskDeleted(Task task, int totalTasks) {

* Shows a message when a task is marked as done.
* @param task The task that was marked as done.
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");

System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
